sample.title: How Circular Deals Are Driving the AI Boom
sample.description:
The AI boom is everywhere, but much of it is illusory, with money flowing between a few players who have yet to profit. If it is a bubble and it pops, the consequences for everyone may be dire. 

If it turns out that AI is a bubble and it does indeed pop as many are warning, the consequences for everyone may be dire. Bloomberg Originals explains how circular deals between AI players figure into what‚Äôs being called the ‚Äúwager to end them all.‚Äù

#ai #tech #nvidia

sample.title: Why Lowe's Is Betting On New Generations Of Shoppers
sample.description:
Lowe‚Äôs sales haven‚Äôt been able to regain its pandemic highs, and the home improvement retailer is hoping younger shoppers can help bolster sales. The company has expanded its merchandise selection and leaned into a stronger social media presence to appeal to Gen Z and young millennials. CNBC's Melissa Repko breaks down how Lowe‚Äôs is seeking new avenues of growth.

sample.title: Why Europe Is So Important To A Warner Bros. Discovery Deal
sample.description:
The future of the Warner Bros. Discovery deal could come down to European regulators. Netflix has agreed to pay $27.75 per share for WBD‚Äôs movie studio and streaming business, but not its cable networks, while Paramount is attempting to acquire everything. Here‚Äôs what regulators are looking for and how this hurdle could shape the media landscape. Alex Sherman has more.

Reporting by: Alex Sherman

sample.title: Can Trump fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook?
sample.description:

sample.title: Meta‚Äôs $2 Billion Bet To Win Over Enterprise Customers
sample.description:
In its latest aggressive AI move, Meta has acquired the intelligent agent firm Manus for $2 billion. The deal underscores Meta‚Äôs pursuit of enterprise dominance as the company faces mounting pressure to justify its massive AI infrastructure costs. However, the acquisition has sparked immediate backlash, with long-time Manus users retreating from the platform following the announcement. CNBC‚Äôs Julia Boorstin explores the high-stakes implications for Mark Zuckerberg as he warns investors that 2026 will see a significant surge in capital expenditures.

Produced and Edited by: Andrew Evers
Reporting by: Julia Boorstin, Stephen Desaulniers

sample.title: Why Tariff Refunds Might Not Lower Prices
sample.description:
If the Supreme Court rules the tariffs are illegal, the refund process could become a lengthy back-and-forth between courts. Meanwhile, consumers are unlikely to see price drops as businesses deal with cash flow crunches. CNBC's Lori Ann LaRocco breaks down the three likeliest scenarios and why businesses will still be left waiting for their money.

Produced, Shot and Edited by: Charlotte Morabito
Reporting by: Lori Ann LaRocco
Animation: Jason Reginato, Emily Park

sample.title: EU leaders held emergency summit in Brussels to discuss Greenland | BBC News
sample.description:
European Union leaders held an emergency informal summit to address an escalation in transatlantic tensions regarding Greenland and US trade threats.
 
The EU said it will defend itself from any kind of coercion after US President Donald Trump took back his threats to impose tariffs on US allies who opposed his plan to take over Greenland.
 
Trump said a framework deal with the NATO secretary general would allow the US to achieve everything it‚Äôs wanted in the semi-autonomous Danish territory.
 
The meeting concluded during the early hours of Friday morning, with Denmark‚Äôs Prime Minister now travelling from Brussels to Greenland.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews

sample.title: Zelensky hopes first Ukraine, Russia and US talks are 'step towards ending war' | BBC News
sample.description:
Russian, Ukrainian and US negotiators are heading to Abu Dhabi on Friday for the first trilateral talks since Russia's full-scale invasion nearly four years ago. 

These talks are crunch time for Ukraine, with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky suggesting the meeting will focus on the status of Ukraine's eastern Donbas region.
 
At the World Economic Forum in Davos yesterday, Zelensky said he had reached an agreement with Trump on future US security guarantees for Ukraine in the event of a deal.
 
It comes after Russia's President Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump's envoys held what the Kremlin called "useful" but "very frank" talks in Moscow.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog 
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
 
#Ukraine #Russia #BBCNews

UK Deputy PM David Lammy on his friendship with US Vice-President JD Vance. #Politics #BBCNews
Politicians react as Trump claims Nato troops avoided front lines | BBC Question Time
sample.description:
Following a tense week for European nations over Donald Trump‚Äôs threats to Greenland, fresh outrage has been sparked as the US President claimed Nato troops avoided Afghanistan's front line.
 
Trump told Fox News on Thursday: "They'll say they sent some troops to Afghanistan... and they did, they stayed a little back, a little off the front lines."
 
The UK was among several allies to join the US in Afghanistan from 2001, and a total of 457 British service personnel were killed in the conflict.
 
Watch what the BBC Question Time panel said on the audience question: ‚ÄúCan we have a ‚Äôspecial relationship‚Äô if Trump can‚Äôt be trusted?"

Catch up with the whole of the debate with BBC Question Time on iPlayer and Sounds now.
